data.text: @tapas321 @VictimOfMaths Yes. I've just inspected the Euromomo data. I see your point.

@bockers56 @VictimOfMaths Every country will have different measures to report MV & covid mortality. For mortality probably the best way to find a comparison is via excess deaths (z scores by country), the difference between England & large western EU countries has been pretty pronounced for a year now.

@VictimOfMaths It has looked particularly satisfactory in comparison to our neighbours for three straight months now. I'd love to know the reason, given that the equivalent death comparison is not nearly as impressive. https://t.co/s4EELxbIc9

Note that this is patients in bed with mechanical ventilation capacity, not necessarily patients on ventilators.

And no, I've no idea why London's line is so much higher, but it's been pretty consistely like that for a long time.
